channel.title: Nature Communications - current - nature.com science feeds
channel.description: Nature Communications is an online-only, multidisciplinary journal dedicated to publishing high-quality research in all areas of the biological, physical and chemical sciences. Papers published by the journal represent important advances of significance to specialists within each field.

item.title: Programmable C:G to G:C genome editing with CRISPR-Cas9-directed base excision repair proteins
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21559-9

Many diseases are caused by single-nucleotide polymorphisms. Here, the authors present CRISPR base editors that use the base excision machinery for single-base transversions.
item.dc:title: Programmable C:G to G:C genome editing with CRISPR-Cas9-directed base excision repair proteins
item.dc:creator: Liwei Chen
Jung Eun Park
Peter Paa
Priscilla D. Rajakumar
Hong-Ting Prekop
Yi Ting Chew
Swathi N. Manivannan
Wei Leong Chew

item.title: Imine as a linchpin approach for meta-C–H functionalization
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21633-2

Site-selective C–H functionalization still faces some challenges, such as the introduction and removal of an appropriate directing group. Here, the authors introduce a temporary directing group for selective meta-C–H functionalization of 2-arylbenzaldehydes via reversible imine formation.
item.dc:title: Imine as a linchpin approach for meta-C–H functionalization
item.dc:creator: Sukdev Bag
Sadhan Jana
Sukumar Pradhan
Suman Bhowmick
Nupur Goswami
Soumya Kumar Sinha
Debabrata Maiti

item.title: Observation of an electronic order along [110] direction in FeSe
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21318-w

Understanding the relation of different electronic orders in high temperature superconductors is of fundamental interest. Here, the authors observe a checkerboard charge order along [110] direction of FeSe.
item.dc:title: Observation of an electronic order along [110] direction in FeSe
item.dc:creator: Kunliang Bu
Wenhao Zhang
Ying Fei
Yuan Zheng
Fangzhou Ai
Zongxiu Wu
Qisi Wang
Hongliang Wo
Jun Zhao
Yi Yin

item.title: N4BP1 negatively regulates NF-κB by binding and inhibiting NEMO oligomerization
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21711-5

NF-κB signalling is critical to TLR mediated cytokine release in various immune responses. Here the authors show how N4BP1 inhibits NEMO signalling and subsequent NF-κB activation and how this pathway is negatively regulated by caspase-8 cleavage of N4BP1.
item.dc:title: N4BP1 negatively regulates NF-κB by binding and inhibiting NEMO oligomerization
item.dc:creator: Hexin Shi
Lei Sun
Ying Wang
Aijie Liu
Xiaoming Zhan
Xiaohong Li

item.title: Caldera resurgence during the 2018 eruption of Sierra Negra volcano, Galápagos Islands
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21596-4

The authors here present geodetic and seismic data for a complete eruptive cycle (2005-2018) for Sierra Negra volcano, Galapagos Island. The data shows the largest pre-eruptive inflation (6.5 m) and rates of seismicity ever observed before a basaltic eruption and provides a rare illustration of caldera resurgence mechanisms.
item.dc:title: Caldera resurgence during the 2018 eruption of Sierra Negra volcano, Galápagos Islands

item.title: Large-scale discovery of protein interactions at residue resolution using co-evolution calculated from genomic sequences
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21636-z

Our understanding of the residue-level details of protein interactions remains incomplete. Here, the authors show sequence coevolution can be used to infer interacting proteins with residue-level details, including predicting 467 interactions de novo in the Escherichia coli cell envelope proteome.
item.dc:title: Large-scale discovery of protein interactions at residue resolution using co-evolution calculated from genomic sequences
item.dc:creator: Anna G. Green
Hadeer Elhabashy
Kelly P. Brock
Rohan Maddamsetti
Oliver Kohlbacher
Debora S. Marks

item.title: Graphene/MoS<sub>2</sub>/FeCoNi(OH)<sub>x</sub> and Graphene/MoS<sub>2</sub>/FeCoNiP<sub>x</sub> multilayer-stacked vertical nanosheets on carbon fibers for highly efficient overall water splitting
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21742-y

While water-splitting electrocatalysis offers a renewable means for carbon-neutral energy production, it is a challenge to design efficient, active, and stable catalysts. Here, authors prepare multilayer composite nanosheet materials as bifunctional water-splitting electrocatalysts.
item.dc:title: Graphene/MoS<sub>2</sub>/FeCoNi(OH)<sub>x</sub> and Graphene/MoS<sub>2</sub>/FeCoNiP<sub>x</sub> multilayer-stacked vertical nanosheets on carbon fibers for highly efficient overall water splitting
item.dc:creator: Xixi Ji
Yanhong Lin
Jie Zeng
Zhonghua Ren
Zijia Lin
Yongbiao Mu
Yejun Qiu
Jie Yu

item.title: Structures of mouse and human GITR–GITRL complexes reveal unique TNF superfamily interactions
item.content:encoded:
Nature Communications, Published online: 02 March 2021; doi:10.1038/s41467-021-21563-z

Glucocorticoid-induced tumor necrosis factor receptor-related protein (GITR) and GITR ligand (GITRL) regulate immune cell activities, including anti-tumor immune responses. Structures and visualization of human and mouse GITR–GITRL complexes offer insight into the architecture of higher-order membrane assemblies, and their signaling.
item.dc:title: Structures of mouse and human GITR–GITRL complexes reveal unique TNF superfamily interactions
